title: A Time for Everything
shortSummary: Ecclesiastes 3 teaches that God has ordained a proper time for every event and purpose under heaven, highlighting the divine order in the rhythms of life. It encourages believers to find joy in their labor and to trust God's sovereign timing despite life's mysteries and apparent injustices.
timeline: c. 10th century BC - Solomon's reign, traditionally attributed to the writing of Ecclesiastes

keyCharacters.name: The Preacher (Qoheleth)
keyCharacters.description: The author and speaker of Ecclesiastes, traditionally identified as Solomon, who reflects on the meaning and timing of life’s events.

keyCharacters.name: Sons of Men
keyCharacters.description: Human beings referenced throughout the chapter as those who experience the seasons of life and labor under God’s providence.

definitions.definition: Hard work or toil; the effort and labor given to life's tasks as assigned by God.
Meaninglessness or futility; the transient and ultimately unsatisfying nature of earthly life apart from God.
The immaterial part of a person; here it contrasts the upward-going spirit of man with the downward-going spirit of beasts, referring to the soul’s destiny.
A reverent awe and respect for God that leads to obedience and trust in His sovereign plan.

outline.heading: The Seasons of Life
outline.description: This section poetically lists contrasting times and seasons ordained by God for every human experience, emphasizing divine sovereignty over life's rhythms.

outline.heading: The Purpose and Profit of Labor
outline.description: The Preacher reflects on the toil God has given mankind, affirming that enjoying one’s work and life’s blessings is a gift from God.

outline.heading: God’s Eternal Decree
outline.description: These verses declare the permanence of God’s works and the certainty that all things have their appointed time, calling for reverence toward God.

outline.heading: The Reality of Judgment and Human Frailty
outline.description: The Preacher observes the presence of injustice in the world but trusts that God will judge all. He also reflects on human mortality and the limits of human understanding.

application: Trust God’s sovereign timing in all circumstances, recognizing that every season has a divine purpose.
Rejoice in and be thankful for the work and blessings God provides, seeing them as gifts to be enjoyed.
Live with reverence and fear of God, acknowledging His eternal plan and judgment.
Remember the brevity of life and the equality of all before God, encouraging humility and dependence on Him.

keyVerses.text: To every thing there is a season, and a time to every purpose under the heaven:
keyVerses.significance: This verse sets the theme that God ordains the timing of all events in life, teaching trust in His sovereign plan.

keyVerses.text: He hath made every thing beautiful in his time: also he hath set the world in their heart, so that no man can find out the work that God maketh from the beginning to the end.
keyVerses.significance: It highlights God’s perfect timing and the mystery of His providence beyond human understanding.

keyVerses.text: And also that every man should eat and drink, and enjoy the good of all his labour, it is the gift of God.
keyVerses.significance: This verse reminds believers to gratefully enjoy God’s blessings as a gracious gift amid life’s labors.

keyVerses.text: I said in mine heart, God shall judge the righteous and the wicked: for there is a time there for every purpose and for every work.
keyVerses.significance: It affirms the certainty of divine judgment and the ultimate justice of God’s timing.
